snippet: Playing three days after running back Ray Rice was released, Baltimore got a pair of touchdown passes from Joe Flacco and rolled past Pittsburgh, 26-6, on Thursday night.
abstract: NFL Roundup; Baltimore Ravens beat Pittsburgh Steelers, 26-6, seeming not to suffer from absence of Pro Bowl running back Ray Rice after his suspension and release from team for domestic violence; other football news noted.

byline.original: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS and KEN BELSON

lead_paragraph: Playing three days after running back Ray Rice was released, Baltimore got a pair of touchdown passes from Joe Flacco and rolled past Pittsburgh, 26-6, on Thursday night.

headline.main: Ravens Beat Steelers Despite a Notable Absence
headline.print_headline: Ravens Win Despite a Notable Absence
